Let's get the insurance companies to act for the people and not for themselves.

You pay car insurance for no apparent reason, clearly.
You pay your premium and when you need to use your insurance because some idiot has hit your car and run (a crime and not your fault) you are required to pay more money? (Yep, pointless as you've already paid for insurance remember?)

As a recent campaign by Labour’s shadow transport minister John Woodcock has highlighted, blameless motorists can still face premium increases simply because they’ve been involved in an accident.

But even if your car is damaged by another motorist, you can still lose out by making a claim against them – even if they admit liability and allow your insurer to claw back any repair costs from their policy.

I've spoken to loads of people who are scared to use their insurance because prices are astronomical

Let's get it sorted ONE PRICE UPFRONT to ACTUALLY USE YOUR INSURANCE WHEN WE NEED IT MOST.
